title: Foul ball drills security guard working the Astros dugout during Game 2 of the ALCS
text:
CLOSE

In a scary scene during Game 2 of the American League Championship Series, a member of the ballpark security staff was hit by a rocket foul ball off Michael Brantley's bat in the Astros' dugout at Minute Maid Park.

Play was stopped temporarily as members of the Houston training staff tended to the injured security guard. Astros players in the dugout were seen distraught and with their hands on their heads in concern.

Brantley was clearly shaken from the incident and Astros manager A.J. Hinch came out of the dugout to him during the delay.

He ended up reaching first base after a wild pitch by Adam Ottavino on a missed swinging third strike.

A security guard is tended to in the Astros dugout after being hit by a foul ball. (Photo: Troy Taormina, USA TODAY Sports)

Fox confirmed that the ball hit a member of the security team. He was walked to the clubhouse with a towel over his head. An Astros spokesman said the club did not have any details or an update on the man's condition.

The Astros extended the protective netting to the stands earlier this year. The benches are protected with a fence, but it's easy for balls to get over and go into the dugout.

This Brantley foul ball hits a member in of the Astros support staff. I’m pretty sure you can hear someone yell “need a doctor” at the end of this video. pic.twitter.com/me0N21hugN — ToughCall 🇨🇦 (@ToughCallBlog) October 14, 2019
description: A member of the security staff at the ALCS was drilled by a foul ball while sitting in the dugout. Play was temporarily halted.
